rules: If your Active Pokémon is a Baby Pokémon and your opponent announces an attack, your opponent flips a coin (before doing anything else). If tails, your opponent's turn ends.

attacks.name: Energy Kiss
attacks.text: Flip a number of coins equal to the number of Energy cards attached to the Defending Pokémon. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

data.name: Professor Oak
rules: Discard your hand, then draw 7 cards.

data.name: Sharpedo

abilities.name: Rough Skin
abilities.text: If this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon and is damaged by an opponent's attack (even if this Pokémon is Knocked Out), put 3 damage counters on the Attacking Pokémon.

attacks.name: Aqua Impact
attacks.text: This attack does 20 more damage for each Colorless in your opponent's Active Pokémon's Retreat Cost.

data.flavorText: It has a sad history. In the past, its dorsal fin was a treasured foodstuff, so this Pokémon became a victim of overfishing.

data.name: Zacian

attacks.name: Metal Armament
attacks.text: Attach a basic Energy card from your discard pile to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Amazing Sword
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Pokémon VMAX in play, this attack does 150 more damage.

data.flavorText: Now armed with a weapon it used in ancient times, this Pokémon needs only a single strike to fell even Gigantamax Pokémon.

data.name: Kommo-o

attacks.name: War Cry
attacks.text: If you have fewer Pokémon in play than your opponent, this attack does 90 more damage.

attacks.name: Clanging Scales
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 30 more damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.flavorText: When it spots enemies, it threatens them by jingling the scales on its tail. Weak opponents will crack and flee in panic.

data.name: Patrat

attacks.name: Hyper Fang
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

data.flavorText: Extremely cautious, they take shifts to maintain a constant watch of their nest. They feel insecure without a lookout.

data.name: Mankey

attacks.name: Rage
attacks.text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on Mankey.

data.flavorText: It lives in treetop colonies. If one becomes enraged, the whole colony rampages for no reason.

data.name: Pokédex
rules: Look at the top 5 cards of your deck and put them back in any order.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

attacks.name: Bubble
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Smash Turn
attacks.text: After your attack, you may switch Squirtle with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Swinub

attacks.name: Freezing Breath
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed. If tails, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Take Down
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, Swinub does 10 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: It loves eating mushrooms that grow under dead grass. It also finds hot springs while foraging.

data.name: Watchog

attacks.name: Watcheck
attacks.text: Look at the top 5 cards of your opponent's deck and put them back on top of his or her deck in any order.

attacks.name: Quick Tail Smash
attacks.text: Before doing damage, you may flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 60 more damage. If tails, this attack does nothing.

data.flavorText: When they see an enemy, their tails stand high, and they spit the seeds of berries stored in their cheek pouches.

attacks.name: Psycho Waves
attacks.text: Discard an Energy card attached to Venonat. The Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

data.name: Pikachu

attacks.name: Thundershock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: It occasionally uses an electric shock to recharge a fellow Pikachu that is in a weakened state.

data.name: TV Reporter
rules: You can play only one Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokémon. When your turn ends, discard this card.
Draw 3 cards. Then discard any 1 card from your hand.

data.name: Alolan Muk-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Chemical Breath
attacks.text: This attack does 70 more damage for each Special Condition affecting your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Crunch
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Tri Hazard-GX
attacks.text: Switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with their Active Pokémon. The new Active Pokémon is now Burned, Paralyzed, and Poisoned. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Holon Fossil
rules: Flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for an Omanyte, Kabuto, Aerodactyl, Aerodactyl ex, Lileep, or Anorith and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward. If tails, put an Omanyte, Kabuto, Aerodactyl, Aerodactyl ex, Lileep, or Anorith from your hand onto your Bench. Treat the new Benched Pokémon as a Basic Pokémon.

data.name: Pikachu

attacks.name: Thunder Wave
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: A plan was recently announced to gather many Pikachu and make an electric power plant.

data.name: Gible
data.flavorText: It attacks using its huge mouth. While its attacks are powerful, it hurts itself out of clumsiness, too.

data.name: Energy Charge
rules: Flip a coin. If heads, search your discard pile for 2 Energy cards (1 if there is only 1), show them to your opponent, and shuffle them into your deck.

attacks.name: Lazy Punch
attacks.text: Slakoth can't attack during your next turn.

attacks.name: Recharge
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Lightning Energy card and attach it to Voltorb. Shuffle your deck afterward.

abilities.name: Overgrow
abilities.text: As long as Turtwig GL's remaining HP is 60 or less, each of Turtwig GL's attacks does 30 more damage to the Defending Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Giga Drain
attacks.text: After your attack, remove from Turtwig GL the number of damage counters equal to the damage you did to the Defending Pokémon.

data.name: Wooper
data.flavorText: This Pokémon lives in cold water. It will leave the water to search for food when it gets cold outside.

data.name: Unown [S]
rules: You may have up to 4 Basic Pokémon cards in your deck with Unown in their names.

abilities.name: [Search]
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may look at 1 of your Prize cards. Return that Prize card face down. This power can be used even if Unown [S] is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: It is believed that the variety of types of this Pokémon were created by evolutionary adaptation, as each possesses a different ability.

attacks.name: Poison Breath
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.name: Landorus-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Hammerhead
attacks.text: Does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Land's Judgment
attacks.text: You may discard all Fighting Energy attached to this Pokémon. If you do, this attack does 70 more damage.

data.name: Team Flare Grunt
rules: Discard an Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Fearow

attacks.name: Fly
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing. If heads, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon during your opponent's next turn.

data.flavorText: With its huge and magnificent wings, it can keep aloft without ever having to land or rest.

data.name: Pokémon Center
rules: Once during each player's turn, that player may heal 20 damage from 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.
This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.

attacks.name: Rock Hurl
attacks.text: Don't apply Resistance.

attacks.name: Rock Slide
attacks.text: Choose 2 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon (1 if he or she has only 1). This attack does 10 damage to each of those Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Hatenna

attacks.name: Find a Friend
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Pokémon, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.flavorText: Via the protrusion on its head, it senses other creatures' emotions. If you don't have a calm disposition, it will never warm up to you.

data.name: Bisharp

attacks.name: Energy Stream
attacks.text: Attach a Metal Energy card from your discard pile to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Metal Scissors
attacks.text: Does 20 more damage for each Metal Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It leads a group of Pawniard. It battles to become the boss, but will be driven from the group if it loses.

attacks.name: Yawn
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.name: Moomoo Milk
rules: Choose 1 of your Pokémon. Flip 2 coins. For each heads, remove 3 damage counters from that Pokémon.

data.name: Poké Ball
rules: Flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for a Basic Pokémon or Evolution card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

abilities.name: Opponent's Choice
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may reveal the top 2 cards of your deck and your opponent chooses 1 of them. Put that card into your hand and the other card on the bottom of your deck. This power can't be used if Slowking is affected by a Special Condition.

data.name: Mewtwo-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Full Burst
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage times the amount of Energy attached to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Super Absorption
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Psystrike-GX
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by any effects on your opponent's Active Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Regirock ★
rules: You can't have more than 1 Pokémon Star in your deck.

attacks.name: Dig Drain
attacks.text: Remove 1 damage counter from Regirock Star.

attacks.name: Final Blast
attacks.text: If your opponent has only 1 Prize card left and Regirock Star is the only Pokémon you have in play, this attack's base damage is 100 instead of 30.

data.name: Chansey

attacks.name: Continuous Tumble
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

data.flavorText: A kindly Pokémon that lays highly nutritious eggs and shares them with injured Pokémon or people.

data.name: Skorupi

attacks.name: Knock Off
attacks.text: Discard a random card from your opponent's hand.

data.flavorText: It grips prey with its tail claws and injects poison. It tenaciously hangs on until the poison takes.

data.name: Mawile

attacks.name: Tight Jaw
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: Attached to its head is a huge set of jaws formed by horns. It can chew through iron beams.

data.name: Nidoran ♀

attacks.name: Fury Swipes
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Basic Pokémon named Nidoran ♀ or Nidoran ♂ and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward. (You can't use this attack if your Bench is full.)

data.flavorText: Although small, its venomous barbs make this Pokémon dangerous. The female has smaller horns.

data.name: Musharna

attacks.name: Sleepy Pulse
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep. During Pokémon Checkup, your opponent flips 2 coins instead of 1. If either of them is tails, that Pokémon is still Asleep.

attacks.name: Super Hypnoblast
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is Asleep, this attack does 120 more damage.

data.flavorText: It drowses and dreams all the time. It's best to leave it be if it's just woken up, as it's a terrible grump when freshly roused from sleep.

data.name: Purrloin

attacks.name: Scout
attacks.text: Your opponent reveals his or her hand.

attacks.name: Fasten Claws
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 more damage.

data.flavorText: Their cute act is a ruse. They trick people and steal their valuables just to see the looks on their faces.

data.name: Miltank

abilities.name: Moomoo Malt
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon, whenever you attach an Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Pokémon, heal 90 damage from that Pokémon.

attacks.name: Sitdown Splash
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

data.flavorText: Its milk is high in calories and packed with nutrients. Therefore, if you drink too much of it, you may wind up with a body like Miltank's.

data.name: Aether Foundation Employee
rules: Put 3 Pokémon that have "Alolan" in their names from your discard pile into your hand.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Guzzlord

attacks.name: Lord's Valley
attacks.text: If you have exactly 2, 4, or 6 Prize cards remaining, discard the top 10 cards of your deck.

data.flavorText: A dangerous Ultra Beast, it appears to be eating constantly, but for some reason its droppings have never been found.

data.name: Tyranitar

attacks.name: Slam
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 60 damage for each heads.

attacks.name: Trample
attacks.text: For each Benched Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's), flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 60 damage to that Pokémon. This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance.

data.flavorText: If it rampages, it knocks down mountains and buries rivers. Maps must be redrawn afterward.

data.name: Poké Ball
rules: Flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for a Basic Pokémon or Evolution card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

data.name: Tranquill

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

data.flavorText: It can return to its Trainer's location regardless of the distance separating them.

data.name: Revive
rules: Put 1 Basic Pokémon card from your discard pile onto your Bench. Put damage counters on that Pokémon equal to half its HP (rounded down to the nearest 10). (You can't play Revive if your Bench is full.)

data.name: Pokémon Retriever
rules: Search your discard pile for Basic Pokémon and Evolution cards. You may either show 1 Basic Pokémon or Evolution card to your opponent and put it into your hand, or show a combination of 3 Basic Pokémon or Evolution cards to your opponent and shuffle them into your deck.

data.name: Island Hermit
rules: You can play only one Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokémon. When your turn ends, discard this card.
Choose up to 2 of your Prize cards and put them face up. (These cards remain face up for the rest of the game.) Draw 2 cards.

attacks.name: Gooey Thread
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

data.name: Mudkip

attacks.name: Endeavor
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage plus 20 more damage for each heads.

data.flavorText: To alert it, the fin on its head senses the flow of water. It has the strength to heft boulders.

data.name: Potion
rules: Heal 30 damage from 1 of your Pokémon.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Tangela

attacks.name: Ingrain
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing. If heads, search your deck for a Grass Energy card and attach it to Tangela. Shuffle your deck afterward. If you do, prevent all effects of an attack, including damage, done to Tangela during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Tickle
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: It is shrouded by blue vines. No one has seen the face hidden behind this growth of vines.

data.name: Zoroark

attacks.name: Brutal Bash
attacks.text: Does 20 damage times the number of Darkness Pokémon you have in play.

attacks.name: Dark Rush
attacks.text: Does 20 damage times the number of damage counters on this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Bonds between these Pokémon are very strong. It protects the safety of its pack by tricking its opponents.

data.name: Gallade Spirit Link
rules: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.
Your turn does not end if the Pokémon this card is attached to becomes M Gallade-EX.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Altaria-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Powerful Gain
attacks.text: If this Pokémon was healed during this turn, this attack does 60 more damage and heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Shining Wind
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon has no Weakness.

data.name: Metang

attacks.name: Core Beam
attacks.text: Discard a Metal Energy from this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: When two Beldum link together, their psychic power is doubled. Their intelligence, however, remains unchanged.

data.name: Stunfisk

attacks.name: Flail
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Thunder Blast
attacks.text: Discard a Lightning Energy from this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It conceals itself in the mud of the seashore. Then it waits. When prey touch it, it delivers a jolt of electricity.

data.name: M Ampharos-EX
rules: Mega Evolution rule: When 1 of your Pokémon becomes a Mega Evolution Pokémon, your turn ends.
Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Exavolt
attacks.text: You may do 50 more damage and leave your opponent's Active Pokémon Paralyzed. If you do, this Pokémon does 30 damage to itself.

data.name: Scoop Up Cyclone
rules: Put 1 of your Pokémon and all cards attached to it into your hand.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).
You can't have more than 1 ACE SPEC card in your deck.

data.name: Startling Megaphone
rules: Discard all Pokémon Tool cards attached to each of your opponent's Pokémon.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).
